adjectives.description: colorful (comparative more colorful, superlative most colorful) (American spelling)

examples: It was a colourful vase with red and white hoops on the lid, and red bands above and below the main frieze. These bands also carry a metope pattern in white of triple lines and blobs, which can just be distinguished on the photographs.

entries.meaning: (euphemistic) Profane, obscene, offensive (usually in the phrase colourful language).
examples: Hussain celebrated reaching his ton with a gesture towards the media centre, pointing to the number three on the back of his shirt and offering some colourful language.
